intro: Copiapoa echinoides var. echinoides, commonly known as the Pariñas cactus, is a species native to the Atacama Desert in Chile. It is a columnar cactus with a ribbed stem that can grow up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a shallow root system adapted to arid conditions. It is well-suited for cultivation in dry climates with minimal water requirements.
